title: MHA to resume talks with Kuki-Zo insurgents, says camps near Meitei areas must be closed before renegotiating SoO pact
content: No immediate extension of SoO, it will be renegotiated with stringent ground rules, says Central official; SoO was signed in 2008 and extended each year till 2024 when Manipur government pulled out

title: Centre is trying to frame me: former J&K Governor
content: The case in which ex-J&K Governor Satyapal Malik has been chargesheeted involves the awarding of ₹2,200 crore worth of civil works for the Kiru Hydroelectric Project

title: Answer my questions if you have nothing to hide: Rahul Gandhi to Election Commission
content: Opposition leader questions the Election Commission’s credibility over an “unsigned” response and demands to release post-5 p.m. CCTV footage from booths in Maharashtra

title: Tension at Durgadi Fort as rival Shiv Sena factions clash during Id-ul-Azha prayers
content: Police detain members from both sides as Shinde, Uddhav groups attempt ascent to Durga temple amid prohibitory orders

title: Stop insulting people of Maharashtra, BJP leader tells Rahul Gandhi
content: BJP leader and Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule says Congress became overconfident and failed to work for Assembly elections

title: Rajasthan, Delhi police start recording iris, retina, fingerprints of all arrestees under 2022 law; no DNA collection yet
content: Data being stored in a central server; DNA collection, face-matching not mentioned under CrPI Act, but NCRB preparing guidelines to roll them out in 1,300 locations; huge forensic, logistic capabilities needed, say States

title: R.G. Kar case: Parents of deceased doctor express dissatisfaction with CBI probe
content: The parents said the CBI has not filed any supplementary chargesheet in the rape and murder case, since the first and only chargesheet filed in October 2024

title: Karnataka Transport Department partners with JICA for digital transformation
content: Following a meeting with a JICA delegation led by Yushi Nagano, Head of JICA DxLab, Mr Reddy said the initiative marks a ‘digital leap in transport.’

title: Where women turn the tide
content: In the coastal villages from Karaikal to Nagapattinam, women members of the fishing community are coming into their own, converting symbolic concessions to well-earned victories from a gender-based paradigm. They have edged themselves into the centre of the traditional village power unit vested with men; they hope to lead these panchayat bodies soon, writes Nacchinarkkiniyan M.

title: Every Indian must make a vow to reduce salt, oil consumption by 10%: Nadda
content: Our traditional food includes many types of preparations with millets, which have to be revived, says Union Minister

title: Confident in PM’s wisdom on delimitation: Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu
content: In an interview to The Hindu, the Andhra Pradesh CM, who had played a critical role in the 2001 Constitutional amendment to delay the inter-State redistribution of parliamentary representation for 25 years, says Modi is very clear on keeping national interest as the most important aspect on the issue of delimitation; he also says when the Centre comes out with a policy on the issue, and if south India needs to be worried, then the issue can be discussed

title: Pre-events of Malabar River Festival to be held in 9 local bodies
content: A meeting headed by district collector Snehil Kumar Singh decided to hold local Kayaking competitions to promote local participation; selection trials for the national kayaking team will be held on July 24

title: Deportation may not require legal process: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The Assam Chief Minister cited the validity of a 1950 order to underscore the need to fast-track the detection and deportation of ‘illegal immigrants’

title: BRS faults Congress for misinformation campaign on Kaleshwaram project
content: Former Irrigation Minister T. Harish Rao counters arguments against the project with the support of documents,  blames failure of Congress govt. to get any approvals during 20017-14

title: NIA files chargesheet against Goldy Brar, four others in Gurugram club blasts case
content: Accused linked to Babbar Khalsa International; plot aimed at fuelling communal unrest and disrupting peace, says agency

title: The murder that shook a mountain
content: When 19-year-old hotel receptionist Ankita Bhandari was found dead in 2022 in Uttarakhand, residents of the Himalayan State began protesting the seeming lack of intent to solve the murder. Last week, when a local court gave three men — one politically-connected — life imprisonment, her family was relieved. Then they found out that the case could go to the High Court. Ishita Mishra reports on the parents’ agony at losing their daughter and life as they knew it

title: Finance Ministry rolls back restrictions on procurement of scientific equipment
content: Finance Ministry allows select institutions to procure equipment outside the GEM portal; move comes amid complaints from scientists over sub-standard materials affecting their research

title: EPACK Prefab opens Sandwich Panel manufacturing plant in Tirupati district
content: The facility enhances EPACK’s production capacity by adding 8 lakh sqm per annum, taking the company’s total sandwich panel capacity to 13.10 lakh sqm per annum

title: Poor rural roads in West Bengal blamed for accidents, fatalities ahead of monsoon
content: Families allege negligence amid muddy, dilapidated roads; political blame game intensifies over infrastructure woes

title: "I Want To Stay Here Too": Father Holds On To Grave Of Son Killed In Stampede
content: The video shows BT Lakshman - the father of 21-year-old Bhumik Lakshman, who died in the stampede - wailing at his son's grave at their native village in Hassan district.

title: Music, Liquor, Action: 5 Cops Suspended For Party At Odisha Collector's Residence
content: Loud music boomed and liquor flowed as five policemen turned the guard room within the District Collector's residence in Odisha's Balasore into a party zone.

title: "Lets Build A More Resilient Future": PM Inaugurates Key Conference In France
content: Inaugurating a key conference on disaster-resilient infrastructure in France, Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted that coastal regions and islands are at great risk because of climate change.

title: Sachin Pilot Meets Ashok Gehlot, Invites Him To Programme On Father's 25th Death Anniversary
content: Congress national general secretary Sachin Pilot met former chief minister Ashok Gehlot here on Saturday and invited him to a programme on the 25th death anniversary of his father and former Union minister Rajesh Pilot.

title: Bangladesh Army Chief Meets Muhammad Yunus Along With Navy Chief
content: Bangladesh Army Chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman and the Navy Chief Admiral M Nazmul Hassan met Chief Adviser of Bangladesh's Government, Professor Muhammad Yunus, on Eid-ul-Azha.

title: 5 Boys Paraded Naked For Stealing Chocolates In Bihar, 3 Arrested: Cops
content: Five boys were stripped, garlanded with slippers and paraded naked in Bihar's Sitamarhi district for allegedly stealing chocolates from a grocery shop, police said on Saturday.

title: Riot Police, Anti-ICE Protesters Square Off In Los Angeles After Raids
content: Helmeted police in riot gear turned out in a tense confrontation with protesters in downtown Los Angeles, after a day of federal immigration raids in which dozens of people across the city were reported to be taken into custody.

title: Compensation For Bengaluru Stampede Victims' Families Increased By Rs 15 Lakh
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday increased the compensation amount announced for the kin of the deceased in the stadium stampede from Rs 10 to Rs 25 lakh per family, the government said.

title: Man Killed, Wife Missing: Mohan Yadav Seeks CBI Probe Into Meghalaya Tragedy
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Dr Mohan Yadav has said the state government stands firmly with the family of Sonam Raghuvanshi, the woman who went missing in Meghalaya after her husband was found murdered.

title: Doctor In Debt Administers IV Fluids To Himself In Car, Dies By Suicide
content: A young doctor pursuing his postgraduate medical degree was found dead inside his car near the hill town of Kodaikanal in Tamil Nadu. The doctor was reportedly in debt and allegedly died by suicide after administering intravenous fluids to himself.

title: Myanmar Arrests Six-Year-Old Girl Over Killing Of General
content: Myanmar authorities have arrested 16 people including a six-year-old girl over the assassination of a retired general shot dead in Yangon last month.

title: Honeymoon, Murder, Frantic Search: Timeline Of Indore Couple's Meghalaya Visit
content: Newly wed couple Raja Raghuvanshi and his wife Sonam visited some areas during their honeymoon in Meghalaya before they went missing on May 23. While Raja Raghuvanshi's body was found in a gorge on June 2, a search is still on for his wife.

title: UPSC Bolsters Exam Security with Aadhaar Authentication, AI Surveillance
content: Spurred by the Puja Khedkar controversy and the NEET paper leak scandal, the UPSC is deploying cutting-edge technologies to safeguard its examination process.

title: "Go Shux": Veteran Astronaut Strikes Confident Note Ahead Of Axiom-4 Launch
content: Michael Lopez-Alegria, Chief Astronaut of Axiom Space, trained Shubhanshu Shukla for the Axiom-4 mission for nearly a year.

title: Aviation Watchdog To Probe Highway Landing Of Chopper Headed To Kedarnath
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation will carry out an investigation into the emergency landing made by a private helicopter carrying pilgrims to Kedarnath.

title: "Evasion Won't Protect...": Rahul Gandhi vs Poll Body Over Maharashtra Polls
content: Issuing a rebuttal to Rahul Gandhi's fresh claims of "match-fixing" in the November 2024 Maharashtra elections, the Election Commission has re-released a document  and said the Congress leader's allegations are "completely absurd".

title: Musk To Mattis: How Trump's List Of 'Derangement Syndrome' Critics Keeps Growing
content: Trump cited Musks opposition to the Republican agenda and said that he is "not the first", which might suggest that he is aware that people who had been once close aides have become "hostile", as he says. He added, "I dont know what it is."

title: Centre Orders E-Commerce Platforms To Self-Audit To Identify "Dark Patterns"
content: Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has directed e-commerce platforms to conduct self-audits within three months to identify and eliminate "dark patterns", deceptive design practices that mislead consumers into unintended actions.

title: Gangster Goldy Brar, 4 Others Charged In Gurugram Bomb Attack Case
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has chargesheeted five accused, including Canada-based Khalistani terrorist Goldy Brar, in the 2024 case relating to bomb attacks at two clubs in Gurugram, officials said on Saturday.

title: The $30 Million Plan To Overhaul Tourism Around Egypt's Pyramids
content: Thanks to a $30 million revamp that rethinks the experience, seeing the pyramids is finally inspiring more awe than agony.

title: FBI chief Kash Patel reveals how India is helping America with fentanyl crisis
content: Patel said that he had personally reached out to Indian officials and that joint operations between the FBI and Indian law enforcement were now underway. “I literally just got off the phone with the Indian government,” he said. “I said, I need your help. This stuff’s coming into your country and then they’re moving it from your country because India is not consuming fentanyl.”

title: Tesla CEO teases 'The America Party' even as he backs down in battle with US prez
content: Elon Musk teased the possibility of forming a new political party in America, even as he retreated from his feud with Donald Trump by deleting posts linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. This climbdown occurred after Trump threatened to cut off federal loans and subsidies to Musk's companies.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Compensation raised to Rs 25 lakh; KSCA secretary resigns
content: Following the tragic stampede at the RCB victory celebration that resulted in 11 deaths, Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has increased compensation to Rs 25 lakh per family. A retired HC judge will lead an inquiry into the incident, while two KSCA officials have resigned, taking moral responsibility. The government aims to prevent future occurrences through thorough investigation and cooperation.

title: 'Evasive notes': Rahul hits back after EC's rebuttal on 'polls rigged' claim
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the Election Commission of India (ECI), demanding answers to his allegations of election "match-fixing." This comes after the ECI refuted his claims as "completely absurd." Gandhi insists on the release of consolidated voter rolls and CCTV footage from Maharashtra polling booths to prove transparency.

title: French Open Final 2025: Gauff beats Sabalenka, clinches first clay title
content: Coco Gauff, the 21-year-old American, secured her first French Open title by defeating Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-set final. Gauff's victory marks her second Grand Slam singles title, following her 2023 US Open win. She is the youngest U.S. champion in Paris since Serena Williams in 2002, solidifying her status as a rising star.

title: Tech jobs: Microsoft CEO's advice for Computer Science students; All of us..
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advises aspiring tech professionals to prioritize computational thinking fundamentals, even with AI's growing influence. He emphasizes the importance of logically breaking down problems and designing systematic solutions. Nadella also revealed that AI now contributes significantly to Microsoft's code, writing up to 30% of it.

title: PM Modi, UK foreign secy call for united global action against terrorism
content: Prime Minister Modi urged decisive global action against terrorism during a meeting with UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy, who condemned the Pahalgam attack and affirmed UK's support against cross-border terrorism. Both leaders celebrated the India-UK Free Trade Agreement and Double Taxation Avoidance Convention.

title: French Open 2025 Final: Sinner’s calm meets Alcaraz’s chaos
content: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner will meet World No. 2 and defending champion Carlos Alcaraz in the French Open final on Sunday. It will be the first major final meeting between two men born in the 2000s. They've met in majors before, but not with a trophy on the line. Whoever wins, their unbeaten streak in Grand Slam finals will get snapped.

title: Murshidabad violence: Father-son dragged out, killed in front of family, says chargesheet
content: In Murshidabad, Haragobindo Das and his son Chandan Das were brutally murdered during communal violence sparked by protests over the Waqf (Amendment) Act. A chargesheet filed in Jangipur court names 13 accused, detailing charges of murder, rioting, and house-trespass. The unrest, lasting several days, prompted the deployment of Central Armed Police Forces after large-scale arson and destruction.

title: Too many emails? Google AI CEO says he’d pay big to get rid of them: ‘The thing…'
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis is developing an AI-powered email system to alleviate the burden of inbox management. Hassabis expressed his desire to eliminate emails, even at a high cost, and his team is actively creating a tool that sorts, replies, and ensures important messages are addressed.

title: Tapping out: Kabul may become first modern city to run out of water; crisis looms, warns report
content: Kabul is facing a severe water crisis, potentially becoming the first modern city to completely run out of water. Groundwater extraction far exceeds natural replenishment, with aquifers projected to dry up by 2030, potentially displacing millions. Contamination, infrastructure issues, and climate change exacerbate the problem, forcing families into debt.

title: G7 Summit: 'Strong push from G6 to have India at table'; why Canada couldn't ignore PM Modi
content: Amidst strained relations, Canada invited India to the G7 summit, driven by pressure from other G6 nations seeking stronger strategic partnerships with India. Despite past tensions, India's economic significance and commitment to law enforcement dialogue were key factors in the invitation. Canada aims to demonstrate global relevance through diplomacy.

title: Mumbai conman drugged & raped Nagpur woman; duped her family of Rs 12 lakh
content: Kalpesh Kakkad from Mumbai, posing as a suitor, allegedly drugged and raped a woman in Nagpur. He also siphoned off twelve lakh rupees from her and her brother. The accused promised big returns from stock market investments. Police arrested Kakkad from Pune. Investigations reveal a similar offence in Hyderabad. Authorities are urging other potential victims to come forward.

title: Google's next CEO: Pichai hints at AI leadership; says 'Whoever is running it will have...
content: Sundar Pichai envisions a future Google CEO empowered by an extraordinary AI companion, reflecting the company's deep AI integration. He emphasizes AI as a tool to amplify human productivity, not replace workers, citing his own experimentation with AI coding assistants. Google prepares for a future where AI and human executives collaborate closely, reshaping leadership and work.

title: 'Promised to marry her': 17-year-old strangled, stuffed in suitcase; 8 held in Bihar
content: Bengaluru police arrested eight individuals, including a minor, for the murder of a 17-year-old girl. The victim, from Bihar, was promised marriage by Aashiq Kumar. Kumar, in an intoxicated state, strangled her. He then, with the help of relatives, stuffed her body in a suitcase. The body was discovered near railway tracks. All suspects were apprehended in Bihar.

title: Kidney transplant patient misses flight; Shinde offers seat on chartered plane
content: Eknath Shinde, the Deputy Chief Minister, stepped in to help a kidney transplant patient from Jalgaon who missed her flight to Mumbai. Shinde arranged for her to travel on his chartered plane late Friday night. After a program delay, Shinde ensured the pilots could fly by coordinating medical check-ups, enabling the flight to depart around 9:50 pm.

title: US lawmaker under fire for protesting Sikh prayer in Congress
content: Republican lawmaker Mary Miller faced criticism after misidentifying a Sikh leader as Muslim and questioning his prayer at Congress, falsely claiming America was founded as a Christian nation. The remark drew condemnation from both parties, with Congressman Jeff van Drew defending the Sikh community's values.

title: Meghalaya murder: MP CM Mohan Yadav seeks CBI probe; search on for Indore woman
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has urged Home Minister Amit Shah for a CBI investigation into the disappearance of an Indore couple in Meghalaya. While Raja Rajuvanshi was found dead, his wife, Sonam, remains missing, prompting a murder investigation. Despite challenging weather, extensive search operations involving multiple agencies are underway to locate Sonam, with drones being deployed to aid the efforts.

title: 'You are not going to get rid of chokers tag': Mark Boucher
content: Former South Africa coach Mark Boucher believes a World Test Championship (WTC) victory against Australia could revitalize Test cricket in South Africa. Despite criticism, Boucher highlights South Africa's consistent performance leading to the final. He acknowledges the 'chokers' tag but emphasizes the WTC's different dynamic.

title: Adam Jones arrested for assaulting cop, alcohol intoxication, & disorderly conduct
content: Former Cincinnati Bengals cornerback Adam 'Pacman' Jones was arrested in Northern Kentucky on June 7 for public intoxication, disorderly conduct, and assaulting a police officer. This incident follows a September 2023 arrest at Cincinnati Northern Kentucky International Airport for similar charges, including terroristic threatening after an altercation with a flight crew over a charging port.

title: Rana Daggubati breaks silence on Deepika Padukone’s alleged 8-hour workday demand for 'Spirit'
content: Tollywood star Rana Daggubati has joined the ongoing discussion about work-life balance following Deepika Padukone’s alleged demand for eight-hour workdays in Sandeep Reddy Vanga’s film 'Spirit', which recently stirred considerable buzz in the entertainment industry. Reports suggested that Deepika opted out of the Prabhas-starrer due to contractual disagreements regarding her working hours and remuneration.

title: 'Completely absurd': EC gives 6-point rebuttal to Rahul's 'polls rigged' claim
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has strongly refuted Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's allegations of "match-fixing" in elections, deeming them "completely absurd." The ECI defended the integrity of the electoral process, emphasizing the presence of political party representatives at every stage. They highlighted the meticulous preparation of electoral rolls and the lack of substantiated complaints during the Maharashtra assembly elections.

title: Russia unveils tech for launching drones from space station
content: Russia has developed a groundbreaking technology for automated spacecraft launches and robotic maintenance from orbital stations, a world first. This innovation will be tested on the upcoming Russian Orbital Station (ROS) and later utilized in lunar missions. Deployment of the ROS, envisioned as a robotic drone platform, is slated between 2027 and 2033, following the ISS deorbiting.

title: Once a rebel, always a rebel? Congress's Tharoor dilemma
content: Shashi Tharoor, a prominent figure in the Congress party, has often challenged the party's high command, advocating for internal reforms and questioning his role within the organization. His actions, including contesting the presidential election and publicly praising government policies, have created friction with party leaders.

title: 'Honeymoon tragedy': Meghalaya deploys drones to trace Indore woman
content: In Meghalaya, drones are aiding the search for a missing woman from Indore, Sonam Rajbanshi, amidst challenging weather conditions, while the investigation into her husband's murder proceeds. The couple was on their honeymoon in Sohra. Opposition Leader Mukul Sangma urges increased CCTV surveillance and implementation of the Meghalaya Residents, Safety and Security Act, emphasizing the need for heightened vigilance.

title: Sonia Gandhi taken to hospital in Shimla; stable: Himachal CM's advisor
content: Sonia Gandhi, the former Congress president, was taken to a hospital in Shimla for a routine health check-up after experiencing minor health issues during her visit. Doctors are currently examining her, and she is reported to be in stable condition. This incident occurs a few months after she was hospitalized in Delhi for stomach-related problems.

title: YouTuber Jasbir Singh sent to 2-day police remand on charges of spying for Pak
content: YouTuber Jasbir Singh, accused of spying for Pakistan, was remanded to two-day police custody by a Mohali court. The Punjab Police's SSOC sought further remand to seize his laptop and investigate alleged links to a spy network involving YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and a Pakistani official. Singh's lawyer claims he was falsely implicated after cooperating with the police.

title: MP shocker: Dog drags newborn from hospital toilet in its jaws; probe begins
content: In Mhow, Madhya Pradesh, a stray dog was found carrying a newborn's body near a government hospital toilet. Hospital authorities and police are investigating after a security guard discovered the scene early Saturday. CCTV footage suggests a 17-year-old girl, admitted for colic pain, may have delivered the baby in the toilet and fled with a man.

title: 'Everything went dark': Crash leaves Maha biker with 33 glass pieces in throat
content: In a miraculous recovery, a 20-year-old college student regained his voice after a severe accident in Chakan. He crashed his two-wheeler into a pickup truck, embedding 33 glass pieces in his throat. Doctors at a private hospital successfully removed the glass during a critical surgery, repairing damaged blood vessels and nerves near his voice box.

title: Fans question if Hailee Steinfeld is committed to Josh Allen after just days of marriage
content: Josh Allen is navigating playful fan reactions after a lighthearted red carpet interaction between his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, and actor Michael B. Jordan went viral. Despite the teasing, Allen and Steinfeld, who recently married in a lavish ceremony, appear to be in a strong and supportive relationship, with Allen's focus remaining on the upcoming NFL season.

title: Musk vs Trump: Tesla CEO deletes 'Epstein files' tweet; a bid to mend ties?
content: Elon Musk appears to be softening his stance towards Donald Trump, deleting critical tweets, prompting calls for a full apology from James Fishback. This follows a public spat where Musk criticized Trump's legislative efforts, leading to Trump threatening to end government subsidies for Musk's companies. Musk retaliated by reposting unverified claims about Trump's connection to Jeffrey Epstein, escalating the feud.

title: Sergei Bobrovsky becomes first goalie in NHL history with back-to-back 40-save games
content: Sergei Bobrovsky is making NHL history in the Stanley Cup Final, becoming the first goalie to open the series with consecutive 40-save games. As he leads the Florida Panthers toward glory, Philadelphia Flyers fans are left reliving a trade they’d rather forget watching their former goalie thrive while their own goaltending carousel spins endlessly.

title: Norway Chess: Muzychuk, with much less hype, earns as much as Carlsen
content: Anna Muzychuk, Ukraine's top Grandmaster, secured the Norway Chess Women title. She remained unbeaten in classical games. Muzychuk amassed 16.5 points, edging out competitors. She also received equal prize money of NOK 700,000. This victory highlights her consistent performance in women’s chess. The tournament featured a unique format with Armageddon tiebreaks. Muzychuk's strategic gameplay led to her success in Stavanger.

title: 'Your love & God's grace kept me safe': Tejashwi reacts after convoy accident
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav escaped unharmed after his convoy was hit by an uncontrolled truck and car in Vaishali district. Three security personnel were injured and hospitalized in Patna. Yadav attributed his safety to "people's love and God's grace.

title: Fans in disbelief after New York Giants rookie Skattebo fails to recognize NFL legends
content: New York Giants rookie Cameron Skattebo faced criticism. A video showed him struggling to identify NFL legends. This sparked debate among fans on Reddit. Some were angry, others empathetic. The discussion broadened to generational gaps in NFL knowledge. Fans discussed the transience of fame. Skattebo's experience highlights the importance of understanding NFL history.

title: Odisha: Cops caught dancing drunk at collector's residence, suspended
content: In Balasore, Odisha, five police officers were suspended after a video surfaced showing them partying and drinking alcohol while on duty at the District Collector's residence. The incident occurred on June 1 while the Collector was away, raising concerns about security protocols. An investigation is underway, and further disciplinary actions are expected following the probe.

title: Suspecting affair, Bengaluru man beheads wife after quarrel; surrenders to cops
content: In a shocking incident near Bengaluru, Shankar allegedly beheaded his wife, Manasa, due to suspicions of infidelity. Following a heated argument at their home, Shankar used a sickle to commit the gruesome act. He then rode to the police station with her severed head to surrender, confessing to the crime, leading to his immediate arrest and ongoing investigation.

title: Espionage network exposed: Ex-Pak cop-turned-YouTuber groomed influencers for ISI
content: Indian investigators have identified Nasir, a former Pakistan Police sub-inspector turned YouTuber, as a key ISI handler in cross-border espionage. He and Naushaba Shehzad allegedly cultivated Indian influencers, offering visas and luxury accommodations in exchange for pro-Pakistan content. This operation aimed to create a favorable narrative and gather intelligence, with connections leading to expelled officials and arrested YouTubers.

title: 7 Maoists killed in ongoing Bijapur operation, key leaders among those neutralised
content: Security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district have killed seven Maoists, including top leaders Narasimha Chalam alias Sudhakar and Bhaskar alias Mailarapu Adellu, in a series of encounters over three days. The anti-Naxal operation, ongoing in the Indravati National Park, resulted in the recovery of arms and ammunition.

title: 'Deep-rooted terror conspiracy': NIA charges Goldy Brar, 4 in Gurugram clubs bombing case
content: The NIA has filed a chargesheet against five individuals, including designated terrorist Goldy Brar, concerning the Gurgaon club bombings in December 2024. These attacks, targeting Warehouse and Human Clubs, were orchestrated by Babbar Khalsa International to incite communal tensions. Brar and an associate remain at large, while others have been arrested and charged under various acts.

title: Piyush Chawla retires: Yuvraj Singh pens emotional tribute to former mate
content: Following Piyush Chawla's retirement, Yuvraj Singh praised the leg-spinner's impactful career, highlighting his ability to excel under pressure. Singh acknowledged Chawla's resilience, dedication, and contributions to India's 2007 T20 World Cup and 2011 ODI World Cup victories. He further emphasized Chawla's impressive first-class record and IPL achievements, noting his calm demeanor and commitment on the field.

title: 'Following zero-tolerance policy': Jaishankar reasserts stance on terror
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has reaffirmed India's firm stance against terrorism, expressing gratitude to the United Kingdom for their condemnation of the recent terror attack in Pahalgam. He emphasized India's zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism and stressed the expectation that its partners would understand and support this position.

title: 'Lungi, not lathi': 34 arrested after T'gana cop busts farmer loan scam
content: In Telangana's Adilabad, Inspector Bandari Raju cleverly disguised himself as a farmer to bust a loan fraud racket. Donning a lungi and towel, he infiltrated the group of agents who were exploiting vulnerable farmers by siphoning off money from their loan amounts.

title: Is water actually wet? Scientists reveal the answer
content: The question of whether water is wet delves into science and philosophy, exploring definitions of wetness. Scientifically, wetness results from a liquid's interaction with a solid surface, involving cohesive and adhesive forces. While water makes other things wet, its own wetness depends on the definition used, leading to ongoing debate.

title: Chopper crash-lands near Kedarnath; 4th mishap in 30 days on Char Dham route
content: A helicopter crash-landed in Badasu, Rudraprayag district after taking off from Sirsi helipad. It was en route to Kedarnath with five pilgrims. The tail of the chopper broke during landing. No injuries were reported. This incident marks the fourth helicopter mishap on the Char Dham route within 30 days. DGCA has been notified and shuttle operations continue as scheduled.

title: Bengaluru stampede: KSCA top officials resign; take moral responsibility for 11 deaths
content: Following the tragic stampede at Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium, which resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries, KSCA Secretary A Shankar and Treasurer A E Jairam have resigned. They cited moral responsibility for the incident amid public outcry and an ongoing investigation into crowd management failures during IPL victory celebrations. An FIR has been filed, and the officials sought anticipatory bail.

title: Watch: Sachin surprises Aamir at 'Sitaare Zameen Par' screening; movie releases June 20
content: A viral video captures the heartwarming meeting between Sachin Tendulkar and Aamir Khan at a special screening of 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. Aamir, engrossed in foosball, excitedly greeted Sachin upon his arrival, with the room erupting in chants of the cricket legend's name.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Blame game breaks out between political class and police
content: While the police say they are being made scapegoats, political leaders say they are being singularly targeted

title: Desilting work completed in Tiruchi district ahead of opening of Mettur dam
content: Agricultural Engineering Department too completes desilting of C and D category channels in the district

title: Chhattisgarh tribal leader Arvind Netam bats for delisting STs who have converted their religion
content: His stance on the issue had ‘changed’ as it helped in ‘checking religious conversions’, the former Congressman said after attending an RSS event as its chief guest

title: Watch | Chhagan Bhujbal speaks on OBC reservation and his political comeback | Pulse Maharashtra
content: A sharp, emotional, and deeply political interview, this episode captures the pulse of Maharashtra’s reservation politics.

title: One student and no fresh admissions: Govt. LP school at Mittahalli in Kolar staring at shutdown
content: The school has had no new enrollments for the last four years, with most parents choosing to send children to private English-medium schools

title: A.P. govt. sanctions ₹450-crore water supply project for Mangalagiri-Tadepalli region
content: The project aims to bridge infra gaps in water supply and to ensure reliable service delivery up to 2056, says MA&UD Principal Secretary S. Suresh Kumar

title: Bihar Governor visits Khan Sir’s coaching institute on Eid-al-Adha
content: Governor Arif Mohammad Khan lauds the educator’s service to underprivileged students, discusses education, culture, and social justice

title: Challenging gender norms, one specialty at a time
content: Over the years, attempts have been made to correct the gender imbalance in two specialties - Orthopaedics and Gynaecology

title: Nellore reports seven Covid-19 cases, DM&HO intensifies vigilance
content: Nodal officer says that about 1,000 kits for Rapid Antigen Tests are distributed to 80 PHCs in the district, monitoring of patients in home isolation is followed as per directions

title: Beyond the beat: what policing looks like across Hyderabad
content: Hyderabad’s tri-commissionerates, spread over 9,400 sq km, with 2 crore people, logged in 20,414 cybercrime cases with over ₹1,259 crore in losses, 3,207 road accidents, and rely on over 10 lakh CCTV cameras.

title: Stadium stampede: Karnataka Congress in panic mode after high command pulls up both CM, Dy. CM

title: Judge signs settlement; colleges to pay athletes
content: Schools are now free to begin paying their athletes directly, marking the dawn of a new era in college sports brought about by a multibillion-dollar legal settlement that was formally approved Friday.

title: Sources: Man Utd increase offer for Mbeumo
content: Gab Marcotti reacts to Jadon Sancho's decision to return to Man United after his loan at Chelsea. (0:44) Manchester United  have upped their offer for  Brentford  forward  Bryan Mbeumo , sources have told ESPN. United have already seen the offer of an overall package of around £55 million ($74.5m) knocked back by Brentford. Sources have told ESPN that the improved offer is worth more than £60m. United are pushing to get the deal done as quickly as possible. They've already agreed to trigger the £62.5m release clause in  Matheus Cunha 's contract at Wolves. The Brazilian will formally complete his move to Old Trafford after the international break. Mbeumo, who scored 20  Premier League  goals last season, is next on Ruben Amorim's list as he looks to cure his team's goalscoring problems. According to sources, club bosses have been made aware that the 25-year-old favours a move to United despite interest from Newcastle.
